issue.title: how to clear LottieCompositionCache

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

issue.body:
I find LottieCompositionCache have clear method ,but it restrict to library, can't call this method.

because LottieComposition.images have many bitmap, I want to clear it when other page not use lottie anim.

Can add new api use this method?

body: I am also looking for a solution for this.
Is there find any solution for clear LottitCompositionCache?

> Is there find any solution for clear LottitCompositionCache?

You can use Java Reflection to invoke "LottieCompositionCache.clear()" , but not sure influence

@sunmTree  can you please give me a little bit more details on this?
I am less familiar with the Reflection API.

issue.title: Add the ability to set custom cache keys or set non cache key

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

issue.body:
Add LottieCompositionCache functions now have an optional third parameter for the cache key. Null can be passed in to skip caching.
This can be configured to happen automatically for LottieAnimationView from xml with `lottie_cacheComposition` or programmatically with `setCacheComposition`

Fixes #1289

body:
Unfortunately, URLs are still being cached and PR #1450 did not fix this. Let me quickly outline the problem. When the `cacheKey` is `null`, the cache function of the `LottieCompositionFactory` recognized and honors this case: https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/blob/ee942249214dd6bb1540b746ca0b678a6382b5ee/lottie/src/main/java/com/airbnb/lottie/LottieCompositionFactory.java#L459-L474

Therefore a new network fetch is initiated, as it should be: https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/blob/ee942249214dd6bb1540b746ca0b678a6382b5ee/lottie/src/main/java/com/airbnb/lottie/LottieCompositionFactory.java#L80-L88

However, the `NetworkFetcher` looks in it's cache and returns the cached file, i.e., the end user still sees the wrong animation. IMHO the NetworkFetcher needs to be adjusted to honor the no cache flag, too: https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/blob/master/lottie/src/main/java/com/airbnb/lottie/network/NetworkFetcher.java#L42

issue.title: Is posible to disable caching in android?

repository.name: cordova-plugin-lottie-splashscreen
repository.description: Apache Cordova plugin to show Lottie animations as the splash screen with Airbnb's Lottie wrapper

issue.body: i had a firestore storage link with my data.json to have dinamic splash depending season. this aproach works perfect in ios, but android seems to caching the first data.json it loads. is there a way to disable this caching? and load the  data.json every time from firebase storage??

body:
Additionally to implementing option to disable caching, can you please provide a way to clear it programmatically?
Also that wouldn't be an issue if actual caching would not be so "aggressive". I'm using downloading from url, but if content by url changes, app never sees that and continue using cached animation.

issue.title: Two cache fixes

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

issue.body:
1. Add the ability to skip the network cache
2. Add the ability to clear all Lottie caches
Fixes https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/issues/1289

body:
there is no such things ,anyway i can't find it . and lottie_cacheStrategy and cacheStrategy , it should have been removed.
but in LottieCompositionFactory.fromUrl it still have LottieCompositionCache,however,it can't control the size of local cache in appContext.getCacheDir()
